forumNotes.author: Cappal
forumNotes.content:
Using xboot to make a bootable USB thumb with several tools, antivirus, linux and windows isos.

I just had this error. Have a nice day.

ERROR REPORT ( 05/24/2017 12:23:51 )  
Please submit this error report to developer.  
Operating System version :Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1  
.NET Framework version :4.0.30319.42000  
Error Message :  
Could not load file or assembly 'PGK.Extensions, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=f93e897f802ddcb7' or one of its dependencies. Le fichier spécifié est introuvable.  
StackTrace :  
at A.V.D()  
at A.V.D(ImageItemBase , ProcessLog )  
at A.KB.D()  
at System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart_Context(Object state)  
at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.RunInternal(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state, Boolean preserveSyncCtx)  
at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state, Boolean preserveSyncCtx)  
at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state)  
at System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart()

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
You are missing a very definite (stupid BTW) .Net package:
> **Could not load** file or assembly 'PGK.Extensions, Version=1.0.0.0
>
read:

<http://reboot.pro/forum/126-xboot/>

Any other thread in the Xboot dedicated sub-forum is about that issue, one among the many:

[http://reboot.pro/to...g-gyurus260217/](http://reboot.pro/topic/21438-error-log-gyurus260217/ "")

![:duff:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/duff.gif)

Wonko

forumNotes.author: Cappal
forumNotes.content: No, Master, I am not stupid, simply, I did not know... ![<_<](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dry.png)

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> No, Master, I am not stupid, simply, I did not know... ![<_<](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dry.png)

You misunderstood, it is the .Net package (and the need for it to be in a very specific version) that is stupid.

.Net is IMNSHO an unneeded mass of bloat but if you have 7 or later you have it anyway, and it may be OK, but any program working on it should work and need not a specific package or include that missing package.

![:duff:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/duff.gif)

Wonko
